# Beyond the Border

[![CRAN_Status](http://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/btb)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=btb)

`btb` (“Beyond the Border - Kernel Density Estimation for Urban
Geography”) is an R package which provides functions dedicated to urban
analysis and density estimation using the KDE (kernel density estimator)
method.

A partial transposition of the package in Python is also available:
[btbpy](https://github.com/InseeFrLab/btbpy).

## Description

The
[`btb_smooth()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb_smooth.md)
function allows you to square and smooth geolocated data. It calculates
a classical kernel smoothing (conservative) or a geographically weighted
median. There are four major call modes of the function.

- The first call mode is `btb_smooth(obs, epsg, cellsize, bandwidth)`
  for a classical kernel smoothing and automatic grid.
- The second call mode is
  `btb_smooth(obs, epsg, cellsize, bandwidth, quantiles)` for a
  geographically weighted median and automatic grid.
- The third call mode is
  `btb_smooth(obs, epsg, cellsize, bandwidth, centroids)` for a
  classical kernel smoothing and user grid.
- The fourth call mode is
  `btb_smooth(obs, epsg, cellsize, bandwidth, quantiles, centroids)` for
  a geographically weighted median and user grid.

## Installation

`btb` is available on CRAN and can therefore be readily installed

    install.packages("btb")

To get a bug fix or to use a feature from the development version, you
can install the development version of from GitHub :

    install.packages("devtools")
    devtools::install_github("InseeFr/btb")

## Usage

Details on how to use the package can be found in its
[documentation](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/man). Some applications
for spatial smoothing are presented in [chapter
8](https://www.insee.fr/en/statistiques/fichier/3635545/imet131-l-chapitre-8.pdf)
of the [Handbook of Spatial
Analysis](https://www.insee.fr/en/information/3635545) published by
Insee. You advise you to start by consulting the
[vignette](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/articles/btb.html) of the
package

## References

- Geographically weighted summary statistics : a framework for localised
  exploratory data analysis, C.Brunsdon & al., in Computers, Environment
  and Urban Systems C.Brunsdon & al. (2002)
  [doi:10.1016/S0198-9715(01)00009-6](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0198-9715(01)00009-6)
- Statistical Analysis of Spatial and Spatio-Temporal Point Patterns,
  Third Edition, Diggle, pp. 83-86, (2003)
  [doi:10.1080/13658816.2014.937718](https://doi.org/10.1080/13658816.2014.937718).

# Package index

## All functions

- [`btb`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb.md) : Beyond the
  Border - Kernel Density Estimation for Urban Geography
- [`btb_add_centroids()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb_add_centroids.md)
  : Link points to their centroids
- [`btb_add_inspire()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb_add_inspire.md)
  : Creates Inpire names for a grid
- [`btb_ptsToGrid()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb_ptsToGrid.md)
  : Compute a grid from centroid points
- [`btb_smooth()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/btb_smooth.md)
  : Smoothing with a bisquare kernel or median
- [`constituerGrappes()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/constituerGrappes.md)
  : constituerGrappes
- [`constituerMatriceEffectifs()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/constituerMatriceEffectifs.md)
  : constituerMatriceEffectifs
- [`dfPrix_SP95_2016`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/dfPrix_SP95_2016.md)
  : Unleaded 95 price in France in 2016
- [`dfRestaurantParis`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/dfRestaurantParis.md)
  : Parisian restaurants
- [`dfToGrid()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/dfToGrid.md) :
  Depreciated function of btb_ptsToGrid
- [`kernelSmoothing()`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/kernelSmoothing.md)
  : Depreciated function of btb_smooth
- [`pixel_france`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/pixel_france.md)
  : France grid with 1km square tiles
- [`reunion`](https://inseefr.github.io/btb/reference/reunion.md) :
  Households of Reunion
